problem: In square $ABCD$, a point $P$ lies on side $CD$ such that $DP=3$ times $PC$. If $AB=12$ cm, find the area of triangle $APD$.
solution: Since $DP=3 \times PC$, let $PC=x$. Then, $DP=3x$ and $CD=4x$. Since $CD=12$ cm, $x=3$ cm. Therefore, $DP=9$ cm. Triangle $APD$ is a right triangle (as all angles in a square are right angles) with legs $AP=12$ cm and $PD=9$ cm. Area of $APD = \frac{1}{2} \times AP \times PD = \frac{1}{2} \times 12 \times 9 = 54$ square cm. \(\boxed{54}\)
